reasoning: Extrapulmonary TB comprises ~20% of TB cases; intestinal TB is ~10% of extrapulmonary TB, thus ~2% of all TB. Global TB incidence varies 100-400+ per 100k depending on region. Estimated intestinal TB ~4 per 100k as global average. Limited specific epidemiological data for intestinal TB; confidence capped due to estimation method.
source: Intestinal and peritoneal tuberculosis: changing trends over 10 years and a review of 80 patients; Anand SS et al. (2011). PMC3211607.
